discussion.content:
for me, best answers
- Create and assign a mobile device policy
- Run set-casmailbox

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/client-access/set-casmailbox?view=exchange-ps

-ActiveSyncEnabled
The ActiveSyncEnabled parameter enables or disables Exchange ActiveSync for the mailbox. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $true. When you set this parameter to $false, the other Exchange ActiveSync settings in this cmdlet are ignored.

- craete and assign a mobile device policy
- run the Set-CasMailbox cmdlet

2nd one is right too,
Set-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule
Use the Set-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule cmdlet to set the level of access for the rule.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/set-activesyncdeviceaccessrule?view=exchange-ps

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company purchases new mobile devices for each user in its sales department and marketing department. The new devices only support Exchange
ActiveSync.
You need to configure mobile device access to meet the following requirements:
Apply a specific password policy to all the sales department users.
Prevent all the marketing department users from using an Exchange ActiveSync-based client to access their mailbox.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
the answer is correct, the only valid one is the first as it contains :
Lower case
upper case
special character
a number

comments.content: Thanks! You're right. I missed the 1min Upper/Lower. I was too fixated on the others. Proposed solution is indeed correct.

discussion.content:
There are 4 Complex characters set :
* Lower case letters.
* Upper case letters.
* Digits 0 through 9.
* Special characters (for example, exclamation marks).
The password must contain all of them as specified in MinPasswordComplexCharacters parameter.
Pass1! is the only one that has all 4 types :
- P (Upper case letter)
 - ass (Lower case letter)
- 1 (Digits 0 through 9)
- ! (Special characters)

The proposed solution is correct.
All of them seems to be compliant. Why the correct answer is A?

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization.
All mailboxes are assigned the same mobile device mailbox policy.
You run the command as shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

You have a Microsoft Exchange Server organization that contains the servers shown in the following table.
//IMG//

You have the users shown in the following table.
//IMG//

All users have a Standard CAL.
You need provide an archive mailbox to each user in the organization.
What should you do before you provide each user with an archive mailbox?

choices.A: Upgrade EX01 and EX02 to Exchange Server 2019 Enterprise.
choices.C: Purchase an Enterprise CAL for each user.
choices.D: Upgrade EX01 to Exchange Server 2019 Standard.
choices.B: Move all the mailboxes to EX02.

discussion.content:
In-Place Archive enabled for Enterprise CAL
https://www.microsoft.com/en-au/microsoft-365/exchange/microsoft-exchange-server-licensing-licensing-overview

New-ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule -Characteristic DeviceOS -QueryString "iOS 6.1 10B145" -AccessLevel Block
This example creates device access rules that blocks access for iPhones that are running iOS version 6.1.1.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/devices/new-activesyncdeviceaccessrule?view=exchange-ps

questions.question_text:
You manage a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization that has 3,000 users. Each user has a company-provided mobile device that uses Exchange
ActiveSync.
You discover that devices running a specific operating system version contain a bug that causes the excessive consumption of resources on the Exchange servers.
You need to prevent the devices from accessing email until the devices are updated.
Which cmdlet should you run?

You need to configure a mail flow solution for email that will be sent from each branch office to the Internet. The solution must meet the technical requirements.
What is the best way to achieve the goal? More than one answer choice may achieve the goal. Select the BEST answer.

choices.C: two Send connectors in the main office that both have the default costs.
choices.D: a Send connector in each branch office that has a cost of 100 and uses a Mailbox server in the main office as an SMTP smart host
choices.B: a Send connector in each office that each has the default costs
choices.A: a Send connector in the main office that has a cost of 100 and uses a Mailbox server in each office as an SMTP smart host

discussion.content:
There is no way D satisfy this requirement: "All email sent to external recipients must be delivered by using a local connection to the Internet. If the local connection becomes unavailable, the Internet connection in the main office must be used."
B is closest answer.
